description: LibreOffice Writer and Apache OpenOffice Writer come with premade templates and allow users to create their own. The templates serve as a starting point for creating documents with a uniform appearance, such as company letterheads, memos, newsletters, cover letters, and business plans. After making necessary edits, users can save their documents as ODT, .DOCX , or other formats for sharing or printing.

In OpenOffice Writer, users can download additional templates from the OpenOffice website by navigating to File → New → Templates and Documents and selecting "Get more templates online...". This feature helps streamline document creation for professional and casual users' needs.
NOTE: OTT files conform to the OpenDocument standard (ODF) standard maintained by the Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards (OASIS).
